I think I solved the hcc problem I wrote about yesterday - here was
the problem & exception:

>
> The  thing I haven't been able to get working is the hcc
> ClusterControllerClient. If I do the same thing as in the jndi doc:
>
> public void main(String[] args){
>        //initialize the cluster controller bean
>       ClusterControllerBean ccbean = new ClusterControllerBean();
>       ccbean.init();
>
>        //obtain a handle to the cluster controller client.
>       ClusterControllerClient cc =
>       ClusterControllerClientManager.getDefaultClient();
>
>                    ...
> }
>
> I get an exception on the getDefaultClient part:
>
> Started ClusterControllerBean
> Jun 12, 2007 2:29:11 PM
> org.archive.hcc.util.jmx.MBeanServerConnectionFactory
> createJMXServiceUrl
> INFO: service url:
> service:jmx:rmi://chaz.hul.harvard.edu:8849/jndi/rmi://chaz.hul.harvard.edu:8849/jmxrmi
> Jun 12, 2007 2:29:11 PM
> org.archive.hcc.util.jmx.MBeanServerConnectionFactory createConnection
> INFO: successfully created mbeanServerConnection on
> chaz.hul.harvard.edu/128.103.151.249:8849
> javax.management.InstanceNotFoundException: no mbean found matching
> query:org.archive.hcc:type=ClusterControllerBean,*
>         at org.archive.hcc.client.ClusterControllerClientImpl.init(ClusterControllerClientImpl.java:100)
>         at org.archive.hcc.client.ClusterControllerClientImpl.<init>(ClusterControllerClientImpl.java:89)
>         at org.archive.hcc.client.ClusterControllerClientManager.getDefaultClient(ClusterControllerClientManager.java:70)
>         at edu.harvard.hul.ois.wax.crawl.CrawlController.main(CrawlController.java:48)
> java.lang.RuntimeException:
> javax.management.InstanceNotFoundException: no mbean found matching
> query:org.archive.hcc:type=ClusterControllerBean,*
>         at org.archive.hcc.client.ClusterControllerClientImpl.init(ClusterControllerClientImpl.java:113)
>         at org.archive.hcc.client.ClusterControllerClientImpl.<init>(ClusterControllerClientImpl.java:89)
>         at org.archive.hcc.client.ClusterControllerClientManager.getDefaultClient(ClusterControllerClientManager.java:70)
>         at edu.harvard.hul.ois.wax.crawl.CrawlController.main(CrawlController.java:48)
> Caused by: javax.management.InstanceNotFoundException: no mbean found
> matching query:org.archive.hcc:type=ClusterControllerBean,*
>         at org.archive.hcc.client.ClusterControllerClientImpl.init(ClusterControllerClientImpl.java:100)
>         ... 3 more
> Jun 12, 2007 2:29:11 PM
> org.archive.hcc.client.ClusterControllerClientManager getDefaultClient
> SEVERE: : javax.management.InstanceNotFoundException: no mbean found
> matching query:org.archive.hcc:type=ClusterControllerBean,*
> Exception in thread "main" java.lang.RuntimeException:
> java.lang.RuntimeException:
> javax.management.InstanceNotFoundException: no mbean found matching
> query:org.archive.hcc:type=ClusterControllerBean,*
>         at org.archive.hcc.client.ClusterControllerClientManager.getDefaultClient(ClusterControllerClientManager.java:80)
>         at edu.harvard.hul.ois.wax.crawl.CrawlController.main(CrawlController.java:48)
> Caused by: java.lang.RuntimeException:
> javax.management.InstanceNotFoundException: no mbean found matching
> query:org.archive.hcc:type=ClusterControllerBean,*
>         at org.archive.hcc.client.ClusterControllerClientImpl.init(ClusterControllerClientImpl.java:113)
>         at org.archive.hcc.client.ClusterControllerClientImpl.<init>(ClusterControllerClientImpl.java:89)
>         at org.archive.hcc.client.ClusterControllerClientManager.getDefaultClient(ClusterControllerClientManager.java:70)
>         ... 1 more
> Caused by: javax.management.InstanceNotFoundException: no mbean found
> matching query:org.archive.hcc:type=ClusterControllerBean,*
>         at org.archive.hcc.client.ClusterControllerClientImpl.init(ClusterControllerClientImpl.java:100)
>         ... 3 more
> Jun 12, 2007 2:30:11 PM org.archive.hcc.ClusterControllerBean$3 run
> INFO: running poll task...
>

I changed the JMX port for the hcc ClusterControllerBean &
ClusterControllerClient so that they are the same as each other but
different than the crawlers. I'd just like to verify with someone that
that's how its supposed to work, so for example:
All heritrix instances use JMX port x (like 8849)
The hcc controller bean & client communincate on a different port (like 8850)

I thought different applications could use the same JMX port but if I
use 8849 for all of the above, when I programatically list all the
registered names at that host/JMX port only the crawlers show up.

I think it works for me that all the heritrix crawlers use the same
JMX port because they are running on different machines. Following the
no app can use the same JMX port thing, if I have multiple heritrix
containers running on the same machine - they would have to use
different JMX ports, right?

thanks,
Andrea
